page.title: 04TILSTONE LODGE
page.content: Very little is known about the early history of{Tilstone Lodge}but it is believed that it became the manor house of the village after the Hall had finally been demolished in 1736. The first recorded inhabitant was{Vice {Admiral Tollemache,}who died in 1837. After the Tollemache family left,the Lodge had several owners. The present owners are{Sir Harold and Lady Bibby, who moved there in 1936.Sir Harold was formerly chairman of the{Bibby {Shipping Line.} Lady Bibby is a keen gardener and the gardens of the Lodge are very well kept,much of the work being done by Lady Bibby herself.They contain many beautiful plants,shrubs and trees,some being rare to this country.The gardens are open to the public once a year on {Whit Sunday.}They have also featured in a television programme.
